translation.en: [Tootsie] During the week, I work as a custodian.
I try to stay busy with manual things that I have to do.
I'm just one little peon, but I try to help the school along.
translation.ko: 한낱 잡역부지만 학교에 도움이 되려고 노력해요

translation.en: When I go to bed on Friday nights, my alarm is set for 1:00 a.m.
translation.ko: 금요일 밤에 잠들 때면 알람을 새벽 1시로 맞춰 놔요

translation.en: And I get to Lexington at two.
I put the meat on...
so eight o'clock we're ready for business.
Barbecuing, working at the school,
it keeps me young, it keeps me thinking, "What next?"
translation.ko: 젊게 살 수 있는 것 같아요 다음엔 뭘 할지 생각하죠

translation.en: I do the best I can at the age that I am, and I keep rolling.
translation.ko: 이 나이에도 최선을 다하며 바쁘게 살고 있어요

translation.en: [Daniel] Texas has a lot of iconic foods.
Chili is actually our state food...
but nobody goes on chili road trips.
In Texas, it's barbecue that... that brings that out in people.
translation.ko: 먼 길도 감수하게 하는 텍사스의 명물은 바비큐죠 "대니얼 본 월간 텍사스, 바비큐 에디터"

translation.en: We have this shared love of barbecue that makes you want to go travel around...
translation.ko: 바비큐를 좋아하는 사람들은 바비큐 맛집을 찾아다녀요

translation.en: visit these different restaurants,
try the different styles.
You drive three hours,
you show up at eight o'clock in the morning,
the people are already in line.
People who drive all that way,
translation.ko: 장거리 운전까지 하면서 이곳을 찾는 사람들은

translation.en: they aren't doing it so they can get the same
translation.ko: 장거리 운전까지 하면서 이곳을 찾는 사람들은 오스틴이나 휴스턴에서 맛볼 수 있는 것과 다른 걸 원하죠

translation.en: they can get in Austin or Houston.
translation.ko: 오스틴이나 휴스턴에서 맛볼 수 있는 것과 다른 걸 원하죠

translation.en: They're getting something different.
The first time I went, all that way to Snow's BBQ,
it... it really just blew me away.
This is special.
[Kerry] Appreciate everybody.
If we can get you anything, don't hesitate to holler.
Men's bathroom's here against the fence, ladies' in the building.
translation.ko: 남자 화장실은 울타리 앞에 있고 여자 화장실은 건물 안에 있어요

translation.en: Ice chest full of beer there, y'all help yourself.
[Daniel] There's an energy about coming to Snow's.
Kerry Bexley, he's the owner, he's walking around
translation.ko: 이곳 사장인 케리 벡슬리는 돌아다니면서 사람들한테 맥주를 나눠주고

translation.en: -handing out cold beers... -Whoo!
[Daniel] ...calling out raffle ticket numbers.
Fifty-four.
You can have a trip to the front of the line.
You can have a T-shirt or cap, 10% off or bottle of sauce...
translation.ko: 티셔츠나 모자도 10% 할인되고 소스 한 병도...

translation.en: [Daniel] Getting the food and coming back,
the tables look right over the pit area.
translation.ko: 바비큐 화로 옆에 바로 테이블이 있죠

translation.en: And soon you realize that really part of the whole event of going to Snow's is...
translation.ko: 사람들이 멀리 스노스까지 바비큐를 먹으러 온 건

translation.en: the famous pitmaster, Tootsie Tomanetz.
translation.ko: 바로 유명한 바비큐 장인 투치 토마네츠 때문이죠

translation.en: [Clay] Tootsie's been cooking for over 50 years.
She's an icon in the barbecue community.
And she is one of the hardest working people I've ever met.
translation.ko: "클레이 카우길 스노스 바비큐 셰프" 제가 본 사람 중 가장 열심히 일하는 분이에요

translation.en: [Daniel] At 85 years old,
standing next to a giant fire,
scooping those coals with a shovel, sweating like crazy...
translation.ko: 삽으로 숯을 퍼 나르며 땀을 줄줄 흘리시죠

translation.en: it's a process that is just incredibly painful for a 35-year-old to do,
let alone an 85-year-old.
This is a woman who is at the top of her craft.
translation.ko: 자신의 분야에서 그야말로 최고를 찍은 분이죠

translation.en: In 2008, Snow's was named the number one spot in Texas barbecue.
translation.ko: 2008년 스노스는 텍사스주 최고의 바비큐 가게로 선정됐어요

translation.en: And I think a lot of that is the fact that so many cuts of meat that she cooks
translation.ko: 그 이유는 무엇보다 투치가 요리하는 다량의 고기가

translation.en: are not just good, but, like, special.
And when you know how much effort went into that barbecue,
translation.ko: 이분이 바비큐에 얼마나 노력을 쏟아붓는지 알게 되면

translation.en: there's no greater reward for taking a long trip to a barbecue joint
translation.ko: 바비큐 먹으러 먼 길 오는 것의 최고의 보상이

translation.en: than a hug from Tootsie.
[Tootsie] Growing up in a small town...
one day a year
we would have a community picnic.
Everybody fried up chicken,
and they had potato salads and dewberry cobblers.
And in the afternoon, we'd play baseball.
To think back, the fun that we had...
translation.ko: 다시 생각해 보니 그렇게 즐거웠던 때가

translation.en: I miss that.
Nowaday, we've moved too far away from each other.
translation.ko: 요즘엔 다들 너무 멀리 떨어져 있어요

translation.en: It seems like everybody's too fast,
in too big a rush, and don't have time.
Barbecue brings people together.
translation.ko: 그래도 다들 바비큐 앞에서 하나가 되죠

translation.en: It gives the people time to visit with each other more.
translation.ko: 서로 시간을 내서 모일 수 있는 계기가 되고요

translation.en: People just kind of slow down to speak to one another
translation.ko: 다 같이 얘기를 나누며 숨 고르는 시간을 갖고

translation.en: and look at the bright side of life.
translation.ko: 인생의 긍정적인 면을 볼 수 있게 되죠

translation.en: A lot of people don't realize what a wonderful feeling that is.
translation.ko: 많은 사람이 그게 얼마나 멋진 일인지 몰라요

translation.en: [Daniel] So, you think the idea of coming out this early in the morning
translation.ko: 아침 댓바람부터 바비큐 먹으러 나올 때는

translation.en: for barbecue is ridiculous,
you sit down, take a couple bites, and you're like,
translation.ko: 여기 앉아서 바비큐 몇 입 먹으면

translation.en: "This all makes sense."
[man] Let me get ten pounds.
[announcer] Forty-four pick up. Forty-four pick up.
-[man 1] How are you? -[man 2] Good, you?
[man 1] All right.
[Tootsie] I ain't gonna make it to church tomorrow.
-[woman] Oh, okay. -[Tootsie laughs]
[Daniel] If you go back in the 1800's,
Texas barbecue wasn't so much a food, it was an event.
If you talked about a barbecue,
translation.ko: 바비큐 얘기가 나오는 건 온 동네 사람들이 모여

translation.en: the whole town was gonna come together to celebrate.
translation.ko: 바비큐 얘기가 나오는 건 온 동네 사람들이 모여 축하할 일이 있을 때였죠

translation.en: They were gonna celebrate the Fourth of July,
sometimes even Christmas.
A rail line might finally make it to a town.
translation.ko: 예를 들어 동네에 철도가 들어온다고 하면

translation.en: That would be their celebration, a big barbecue.
translation.ko: 성대한 바비큐 파티를 열면서 축하할 거예요 "바비큐"

translation.en: Here in Central Texas, that tradition has gone on and on.
[Kerry] Barbecues on a Saturday, it's totally a Texan thing.
translation.ko: 토요일마다 바비큐 먹는 건 텍사스의 흔한 일상이에요 "고향의 인심 변하지 않아요!"

translation.en: It's just a weekly event around the area.
translation.ko: 여기선 매주 그렇죠 "케리 벡슬리 스노스 바비큐 사장"

translation.en: Anytime you barbecued, it's just another reason
to bring friends and family together.
translation.ko: 그걸 핑계 삼아 친구와 가족들이 모이죠

translation.en: That's what it's about.
For us, that's Tootsie's cooking, part of the whole experience.
translation.ko: 우리 경우엔 투치 아줌마 요리를 핑계로 모이곤 했었죠

translation.en: I remember as a kid going and having lunch at Miss Tootsie's.
translation.ko: 어렸을 때 투치 아줌마네 가서 점심 먹었던 게 기억나요

translation.en: I remember her coming out of the cooler carrying a quarter side of beef on her shoulder,
translation.ko: 냉장고에서 꺼낸 소고기를 어깨에 걸치고 와서

translation.en: and throwing it down, going to cutting.
That was a part of my life growing up,
and it's still the same today.
People know who she is.
They know how long she's been doing it and the things she's seen.
translation.ko: 그분이 바비큐를 얼마나 오래 했고 경험이 풍부한지 알아요

translation.en: And that's the legacy of Miss Tootsie.
[Tootsie] I was raised on a farm just at the end of the Depression,
translation.ko: 전 대공황이 끝날 무렵 농장에서 자랐어요

translation.en: the oldest of three children.
We lived out in the country,
and times were tight.
We didn't go to town and buy groceries.
The money was just too short for that.
It was just us five doing all the work.
translation.ko: 다섯 식구가 모든 걸 다 했어요

translation.en: The clothing was home sewn.
We had peach trees, so we canned a lot of peaches.
translation.ko: 복숭아나무가 많아서 그걸로 통조림을 대량 생산했어요

translation.en: Wintertime, we butchered our own hogs.
We learned how to make things work without help.
translation.ko: 아무 도움도 없이 삶을 꾸려가는 법을 배웠어요

translation.en: We were taught to handle the situation ourselves.
translation.ko: 우리 스스로 모든 상황을 해결해야 했죠

translation.en: It was my training, I guess.
It gave me the fullness of knowing that I can handle
translation.ko: 덕분에 저 혼자서도 꽤 많은 일을

translation.en: quite a bit of stuff.
translation.ko: 할 수 있단 걸 알게 됐죠

translation.en: I can take care of myself.
So, I have always felt very, uh...
independent.
I'm gonna shut that top to hold that heat in a little bit.
translation.ko: 열을 좀 가둬놔야 하니 뚜껑 좀 덮어놓을게

translation.en: [Kerry] Okay.
With that wind blowing, it's drawing through better.
translation.ko: 바람이 부니 연소에 도움이 될 거야

translation.en: [Daniel] If you look at the history of Texas barbecue,
translation.ko: 텍사스 바비큐의 역사를 쭉 되짚어 보면

translation.en: it was taking wood and burning them down to coals,
using that direct heat to cook the meat.
translation.ko: 직화 방식으로 고기를 조리한다는 걸 알 수 있죠

translation.en: Or doing what we now call Hill Country style barbecue.
Snow's is one of those n Central Texas that still does it the old way.
translation.ko: 스노스는 센트럴텍사스에서 흔치 않게 전통을 고수하는 가게죠

translation.en: Back in those days, people weren't so selective about meat.
translation.ko: 예전엔 사람들이 고기 종류를 그렇게 따지지 않았어요

translation.en: It was, what were the ranchers willing to give up for a big party?
translation.ko: 목장주가 어떤 고기를 내놓든 그걸로 동네잔치를 벌였죠

translation.en: And a lot of the smaller cuts of meat that she cooks,
you have to attend to that meat much more often.
[Kerry] Miss Tootsie's cooking technique, this is kind of country cooking.
translation.ko: 투치의 고기 굽는 기술은 시골 느낌이 물씬 납니다

translation.en: Pork steak,
chicken by the half,
two kinds of sausage, turkey breast.
It's all over direct coals.
There's not a lot of room for error when you do that.
[Daniel] Tootsie is touching the meat with a fork,
translation.ko: 투치는 말 그대로 포크로 고기를 찔러서

translation.en: handling each piece of it to check its done-ness.
There's a... a mop sauce that she adds onto it as well,
and there's no better cut of meat that has been mopped with her mop.
translation.ko: 이렇게 양념한 고기는 그야말로 세계 최고예요

translation.en: Tootsie's Hill Country barbecue.
Not something you're gonna find hardly anywhere else,
because there aren't a lot of pitmasters looking to burn wood down to coals
translation.ko: 투치처럼 나무를 태워서 숯을 만들고 삽으로 화로에 갖다 넣는 바비큐 전문가는 드무니까요

translation.en: and shovel it into pits.
translation.ko: 삽으로 화로에 갖다 넣는 바비큐 전문가는 드무니까요

translation.en: Nobody bothers with that sort of hard work and effort
except for Tootsie and what they do at Snow's.
[Tootsie] After I graduated,
a friend of the family's asked me to write this guy
translation.ko: 우리 가족이랑 친한 친구분께서 군대에 있는 '화이트'란 청년한테 편지를 써달라고 했어요

translation.en: that was in the Army named White,
translation.ko: 군대에 있는 '화이트'란 청년한테 편지를 써달라고 했어요

translation.en: and one day Daddy waved me to the house.
translation.ko: 어느 날 아빠가 절 보고 집에 오라고 손짓하더라고요

translation.en: I walk up and there stands this Army guy in a uniform
translation.ko: 군복 입은 남자가 아빠랑 같이 있었는데

translation.en: and I thought, "God dang, he is nice-looking."
We dated four years
until July of '56 when we married.
So, I felt like that my letter writing might have paid off.
[Kiki] Want the lean or some fat?
[Tootsie] Back in 1966,
my husband worked at the City Meat Market in Giddings,
translation.ko: 남편은 기딩스에 있는 시티 정육 식당에서 일했는데

translation.en: and they were shorthand.
White, he asked me if I would come in and help him.
Silverware and everything's on the table to your right.
I was a mother at home with three children.
translation.ko: 당시 난 세 아이를 키우는 전업주부였고

translation.en: I didn't know anything about barbecue,
but, uh, I was willing to try and learn.
When White and I started working together,
I just kind of learned little bits and pieces.
Cutting up the beef and putting it on the counter.
I would season the meat and put it on the pit for him.
Different things that I could do that helped him get through the day better.
translation.ko: 신랑이 수월하게 일할 수 있게 이런저런 일을 보조했어요

translation.en: White and I just worked as a team.
[Tootsie] How are you doing?
-You? How are y'all? -[woman] Tootsie.
-How are you? -Long time no see.
-Hi, sweetie. [chuckles] -Hidee, hidee!
-Deidra, doing okay? -[Deidra] I have been.
-[Tootsie] Good. -Good to see you.
[Tootsie] Good seeing you. Wish we'd get a little rain.
translation.ko: 얼굴 보니 나도 좋네 비가 좀 내리면 좋을 텐데

translation.en: [Deidra] God, we need it so bad.
Yeah. Good morning.
-[Kiki] How you doing, Tootsie? -What you know, Kiki?
[Kiki] Nothing much. What can we get for you?
Give me pork. -[Kiki] Pork? -Yeah.
[Tootsie] Y'all been busy this week?
[Kiki] Yes, ma'am, very.
[Tootsie] Once I started working at the Meat Market,
I began seeing how much I enjoyed being around people.
translation.ko: 제가 사람들과 어울리는 걸 좋아한다는 사실을 알게 됐죠

translation.en: [Kiki] All righty.
[Tootsie] Okay, thank you.
-Thank you. Have a good one. -[Tootsie] All right.
I enjoyed the work so well I convinced White that we should buy it.
translation.ko: 일을 즐기게 됐고 화이트한테 아예 가게를 매입하자고 했죠

translation.en: We had barbecue on Saturday.
We'd know everyone, we were friends with everyone.
translation.ko: 우리는 동네 사람들과 다 알고 친하게 지냈으니까요

translation.en: [Tootsie] How is you today?
[woman] I is fine. Are you off?
[Tootsie] At the Market, we were a very close-knit family.
My children grew up in the Market.
And the youngest, Hershey, would help me at the pits.
The togetherness with the community and family,
translation.ko: 지역 사회뿐만 아니라 가족과 함께할 수 있으니...

translation.en: -it was more than just business. -[laughing]
translation.ko: 이 일은 저한테 단순한 생계 수단 이상이었죠

translation.en: [Kerry] Clay, how long has this door been dragging?
translation.ko: 클레이, 이 문이 끌린 지 얼마나 됐어?

translation.en: [Clay] Couple months.
[Kerry] Them rods are all the way in now.
[Daniel] Texas barbecue, it really all comes down to brisket.
translation.ko: 텍사스 바비큐는 브리스킷 부위를 주로 써요

translation.en: Barbecue brisket is big hunks of beef cooked for 12, 14, 16 hours.
translation.ko: 브리스킷 바비큐는 소 가슴살을 크게 잘라 12-16시간 요리하죠

translation.en: I don't know why a Snow's brisket
tastes so good and so different.
You take a bite of it, it's like, "God, how did that happen?"
translation.ko: 한 입 베어 물면 탄성이 절로 나온다니까요

translation.en: Maybe some magic that happens within that aluminum foil.
I don't know.
At Snow's, we have no secrets.
I mean, our seasoning is salt and pepper.
I can't tell you how hot my pits are because I feel 'em with my hands.
translation.ko: 화로가 몇 도인지는 나도 몰라요 그냥 손대중으로 굽거든요

translation.en: I don't have a gauge. I guess if I'd put a gauge on,
translation.ko: 온도계도 없고요 화로에 온도계를 달았다면 온도 읽는 법을 배웠지

translation.en: I'd learn to read it and not my hand, but...
translation.ko: 화로에 온도계를 달았다면 온도 읽는 법을 배웠지 손대중으로 하진 않았겠죠

translation.en: uh, it's just something I do.
I guess it's an instinct.
[Daniel] In Texas barbecue,
pitmasters are willing to tell everything they do to it,
translation.ko: 바비큐 장인들이 기꺼이 비법을 알려주려고 해요

translation.en: and then they'll sit back and be like, "Well, good luck."
It isn't about concocting some rub that is your secret ingredient.
translation.ko: 바비큐 맛의 비밀은 비밀 양념 같은 게 아니라

translation.en: The secret is the pitmaster.
[Tootsie] As time went along,
White and I just worked side by side at the Meat Market.
translation.ko: 남편과 전 정육 식당에서 함께 일하게 됐고

translation.en: We operated it for 20 years.
One day, White and I were in the hospital having a carotid artery dye work done.
translation.ko: 그러던 어느 날 남편과 전 목동맥 조영술을 받으러 갔어요

translation.en: And, um, when they brought him back to the room, uh, uh, to look at him, he didn't look right.
translation.ko: 다시 대기실로 왔는데 남편 안색이 안 좋은 거예요

translation.en: And I told the nurse, I said, "He doesn't look right."
translation.ko: 간호사한테 남편 안색이 안 좋다고 하니

translation.en: She says, "He's fine. He's just coming out from the anesthesia."
translation.ko: 마취 깨는 거라 그렇다며 괜찮다고 하더군요

translation.en: Well, I sat with him in the room two hours
when, all of a sudden, he just went limp.
So I pushed a buzzer and I said, "I need help in here."
There were two doctors and three nurses walked in.
And when they said, "He has had a stroke,"
I mean, I-- I just-- I couldn't see going on.
I was scared to death.
White's mental condition had been affected by the stroke.
He was completely lame on one side.
Couldn't stand on his own or get up on his own.
He was helpless.
Partially blind.
Now what do I do?
The doctor told me, "You know, he's gonna need therapy three times a week."
translation.ko: 의사 말로 일주일에 3번은 치료를 받아야 한다더라고요

translation.en: What are we gonna do with the Market?
Not being able to move around
and needing 24-hour care and therapy three times a week,
translation.ko: 종일 봐줘야 하는 데다 주 3회 치료를 받아야 하는데

translation.en: I mean, I couldn't see how I could handle it.
All I could see was to get rid of the Market.
translation.ko: 내가 생각한 유일한 방법은 식당을 처분하는 거였어요

translation.en: A year after White suffered the stroke, he had gotten better.
translation.ko: 뇌졸중 진단을 받고 1년이 지난 후 상태가 좀 나아졌고

translation.en: He got his sight back pretty good,
and he finally got that he could drive again.
I had not worked for a year
because he needed a lot of therapy and home health care.
translation.ko: 전 1년간 일을 할 수 없었죠 그이를 종일 돌보고 치료도 데리고 다녀야 했으니까요

translation.en: It was a tough time.
It was just a lonely feeling there that I had.
A friend of mine said, "Tootsie, why don't you come to work for me at school?"
translation.ko: 그때 친구가 자기 학교에서 일하는 게 어떻겠냐고 하더군요

translation.en: Being outside,
the smell of the fresh air...
birds singing...
kids out on the playground.
I would walk down the hall and those kids would come to the door
translation.ko: 복도를 걸어 다닐 때면 애들이 문까지 와서

translation.en: to say, "Hi, Miss Tootsie."
I really enjoy being around the students.
To talk to people, see people.
translation.ko: 사람들과 말하고 얼굴 보는 것도 좋고요

translation.en: -Hi. Everything good? -[Tootsie] Doing fine.
translation.ko: 안녕하세요, 잘 있었죠? 나야 잘 지내죠

translation.en: [Tootsie] That helped me a lot to eliminate the loneliness that I was having.
Pretty dead. How long you think it's been dead?
translation.ko: 수명을 다한 것 같은데 이렇게 된 지 얼마나 됐을까요?

translation.en: -Couple year? -Maybe three.
[Kerry] Yeah, it'll be... It'll be okay. We'll use part of it.
translation.ko: 그럼 괜찮겠네요 - 일부만 쓸 거예요 - 그래요

translation.en: Okay.
[Kerry] When I had the idea of starting up a barbecue,
I felt like the locals wouldn't be very forgiving
translation.ko: 지역 주민들이 그다지 반기지 않을 거로 생각했죠

translation.en: had I started this without Miss Tootsie.
Living in a small community, you know most everybody, and...
translation.ko: 작은 동네에 살면 주민들을 거의 다 알아요

translation.en: she had barbecued for 20 years here in Lexington.
Miss Tootsie, she's not kin, but basically like family.
[Tootsie] Kerry came by one morning
and asked if I would be interested
in opening a new barbecue place at the old peanut mill.
translation.ko: 바비큐 가게를 열려고 하는데 관심 있냐고 묻더라고요

translation.en: I missed cooking barbecue on Saturdays,
so I said, "Let's sit down and talk."
I told Kerry, "Since you're from Lexington
and you're the first person that I would work with...
translation.ko: 자기랑 같이 일하는 건 대환영이라고 했어요

translation.en: but I need to know you will stick to what you're gonna do
translation.ko: 하지만 나한테 말했던 그대로 약속을 고수할지

translation.en: and don't wish-wash around back and forth."
translation.ko: 말 바꾸는 거 아닌지는 꼭 알아야겠다고 했죠

translation.en: And he said, "Well, if I tell you this is what I'm gonna do, it's in stone."
translation.ko: 그랬더니 케리가 본인 말은 지키겠다고 하더군요

translation.en: So, that was it.
Cooking was a part of my life,
so it was an inspiration that I could continue on.
translation.ko: 계속 요리를 할 수 있다는 게 정말 감격스러웠죠

translation.en: We set the date as March the 1st, 2003,
to open up Snow's BBQ.
-[Tootsie] You turned those? -[Kerry] I was gonna ask you the same.
translation.ko: 그거 돌렸어? 나도 그거 물어보려고 했는데

translation.en: -[Tootsie] I just moved 'em up. -[Kerry] I hadn't.
translation.ko: - 난 안 돌렸어, 그냥 옮겼지 - 나도 안 돌렸어요

translation.en: [Kerry] Sons of bitches are really about ready all the way.
[Tootsie] When we first started Snow's BBQ,
we had only myself, Kerry...
Miss Phyllis Rogers,
and Kerry's two daughters.
We had customers coming in at a slow pace.
We never had a line.
And that went like that until 2008.
[Daniel] In 2008, Snow's was named number one
translation.ko: 2008년에 스노스가 텍사스의 바비큐 전문점 2,000여 곳 중

translation.en: out of about 2,000 barbecue joints in Texas,
and it really did shock the barbecue community.
"Like, what? Who? Where is this place?" We thought we knew all the great ones.
translation.ko: '뭐? 여긴 대체 어딘데?' 맛집은 꿰고 있다고 생각했거든요

translation.en: But here's this new spot that popped up.
translation.ko: 새로 생겼다는데 "83세 할머니 바비큐 여왕으로 등극"

translation.en: It was a spot that nobody had heard of,
but after that list came out,
it didn't take long for the crowds to start to descend on Snow's.
[reporter] The master behind the meat is Tootsie Tomanetz.
-It's fantastic. -Good. Glad you enjoyed it.
When it aired and become public,
just immediately overnight it changed.
We'd have 20 people in line
maybe at a given Saturday, to hundreds.
translation.ko: 방송에 나온 이후 수백 명으로 늘어났죠

translation.en: We were just like could not believe this was happening.
translation.ko: 이렇게 될 줄은 상상도 못 했어요

translation.en: Tootsie and I was at the steps when they told us we're number one,
translation.ko: 1위 소식을 들었을 때 가게 앞에 투치와 있었는데

translation.en: and we just sat there and hugged each other and cried.
And at that point, we had no idea what was yet to come.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 닥칠지 그땐 전혀 몰랐어요

translation.en: -[Kerry] Ready? -[Phyllis] We've been ready.
[Kerry] All righty. Get opened up.
[all] All right.
[Kerry] About four or five's it'll hold at a time.
[woman] Okay.
[Tootsie] To be number one...
I wasn't used to the, uh, publicity.
It was overwhelming how many people came in.
translation.ko: 많은 인파가 몰려와서 겁이 날 지경이었죠

translation.en: The line was all the way back to the Methodist Church.
translation.ko: 줄이 감리교 교회까지 빙 둘러 설 정도였어요

translation.en: It scared me. I thought, "What's gonna happen here?"
translation.ko: 겁이 덜컥 났죠 '이제 어떻게 되는 걸까?'

translation.en: People begin coming up to me to take pictures, or shake my hand,
translation.ko: 사람들이 제게 다가와서 같이 사진을 찍거나 악수하고 안아주기 시작했어요

translation.en: or give me a hug.
It was hard for me to get used to.
[Daniel] I don't think she wanted anybody to be near her back then.
translation.ko: 당시 투치는 사람들이 자기한테 오는 게 싫었던 것 같아요

translation.en: It was really just, "Hey, I'm working over here. Like, let me work."
So, she was a little standoffish.
[Tootsie] It's something you have done all your life
and you're finally being recognized for it.
But at the same time, to have all this, uh...
fame?
It was just... a strange feeling.
[Kerry] What's the weather supposed to be this week?
[Tootsie] Ah, I think Wednesday it's starting to rain again.
translation.ko: 수요일부터 비가 또 올 것 같아

translation.en: [Kerry] Snow's BBQ.
Yes, sir.
Thank you, sir.
[Tootsie] People would be lined up around the block.
translation.ko: 한 블록 넘게 대기 줄이 이어지는데

translation.en: And with me being the only one cooking,
that was a challenge.
So, Kerry asked my son Hershey if he would come in
and start helping on Friday nights.
[Kerry] Tootsie and Hershey, they didn't have a tight relationship.
translation.ko: 투치와 허시는 그다지 친한 편이 아니었고

translation.en: But, uh, they were both pretty hard-headed.
When they were at their wit's end, you could feel it brewing and fixing to hit.
translation.ko: 그래서 둘이 한계에 다다르면 터질 것 같다는 예감이 들었는데

translation.en: Mm-hmm. And it would.
[Tootsie] Me and Hershey,
we really didn't see eye-to-eye.
He was having trouble with his drinking, having trouble with his wife...
translation.ko: 허시는 음주 문제도 있고 아내와도 문제가 있었죠

translation.en: this, that, and the other.
But when Hershey came to work for us,
it was just the two of us together doing the cooking,
so we would kind of have it out at the barbecue pit
translation.ko: 바비큐 화로 앞에서 서로 쌓인 걸 털어냈어요

translation.en: when no one else was around.
You know, you have to sometimes just talk to get it off your chest,
translation.ko: 쌓인 걸 풀려면 그걸 말로 표현해야 할 때가 있잖아요

translation.en: and, uh, barbecuing together, we were able to understand each other better.
translation.ko: 같이 바비큐를 하면서 서로를 더 잘 이해하게 됐죠

translation.en: We got all our bad things ironed out.
It's just something that we both needed.
translation.ko: 우리 모두한테 필요한 일이었던 것 같아요

translation.en: Hershey and I continued cooking barbecue on Saturday.
translation.ko: 허시랑 전 계속해서 토요일에 바비큐를 했죠

translation.en: We became able to work quite well together.
translation.ko: 일할 때 쿵짝이 꽤 잘 맞게 됐어요

translation.en: At that time, White was in hospice care.
They didn't give him much time.
White passed away on a Tuesday and we had the funeral on Sunday.
translation.ko: 남편은 화요일에 세상을 떠났고 일요일에 장례식을 했어요

translation.en: And my life had to continue.
Then one morning right after lunch,
Hershey came over and told us that he had brain cancer.
When Hershey went to the nursing home,
well, I'd go every day,
because his legs had gotten so weak, he couldn't stand on his own.
translation.ko: 아들이 다리가 약해져서 혼자 서지도 못했거든요

translation.en: That was death setting in.
That was it.
The Saturday after his death and funeral,
translation.ko: 허시 장례식을 치른 후 돌아오는 토요일에

translation.en: I went back to work,
and it was hard to see his vehicle there but not him.
translation.ko: 주인 없이 덩그러니 주차돼 있던 허시 차를 보니 울컥하더군요

translation.en: But the whole time I kept barbecuing.
[Daniel] I remember seeing Tootsie.
She had red eyes and a tissue,
translation.ko: 눈이 빨갛게 충혈된 채 휴지를 들고 있었죠

translation.en: and I'm just like, "What are you doing here?"
She said to me, "If I don't keep doing this, what am I gonna do?"
translation.ko: 자기가 여기서 일 안 하면 뭘 하겠냐고 하는 거예요

translation.en: That was a tough time for everybody.
I mean, we did all we could, but it was just real hard on her.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 건 다 했지만 투치는 여전히 힘들어했어요

translation.en: So, we realized we were at a time to where we probably need to call in some help.
[Tootsie] It was about three weeks, four weeks after his funeral,
the people had heard...
and there were so many people come just to express their sympathy to me.
I had a gentleman come up to me to say,
translation.ko: 어떤 양반은 저한테 오더니 이렇게 말했어요

translation.en: "I'll always remember your son
because he gave my two children each a silver dollar."
Another person said,
"I'm sorry for your loss."
I'm gonna give you a kiss on the cheek.
[Tootsie] It helped me a lot
to see the other end of the light.
Through my whole life, I have just always felt very, uh, independent.
translation.ko: 전 제가 굉장히 독립적이라고 생각하며 평생을 살았어요

translation.en: But after White and Hershey passed away,
I learned that I had to call on someone to help me,
translation.ko: 다른 사람한테 기대는 법을 배우게 됐죠

translation.en: and, uh, Kerry was there to help me through the hard part of it.
translation.ko: 제가 힘든 시기를 보내는 동안 케리가 옆에서 많이 도와줬어요

translation.en: I feel a lot of support when I'm down and out.
translation.ko: 슬프거나 힘들 때 도움이 많이 됐죠 "바비큐 축제 투치 토마네츠와 케리 벡슬리"

translation.en: I feel a connection.
I really do.
It's the close-knit barbecue family.
They're holding me up, they're walking with me.
translation.ko: 덕분에 힘든 일을 견디고 앞으로 나아갈 수 있었죠

translation.en: [woman 1] I will be the next Miss Tootsie.
translation.ko: 제가 미스 투치의 뒤를 이을 거예요

translation.en: She's just a staple here and an icon for many.
translation.ko: 텍사스 바비큐의 여왕이자 많은 걸 상징하는 존재죠

translation.en: [Kerry] She represents strength and sincerity.
translation.ko: 투치는 강함과 성실이 뭔지 몸소 보여주는 사람이에요

translation.en: A true Texas legend.
[man] She's proof that if you want something,
translation.ko: 투치는 하고 싶은 일은 나이에 상관없이

translation.en: you can continue to do it regardless of age.
translation.ko: 꾸준히 할 수 있다는 걸 우리에게 보여줬어요

translation.en: [woman 2] Her chicken is the bomb.
[Tootsie] When I lost my husband and my son,
that door closed,
and God knew what he was doing.
He opened these other doors for me.
Number 12!
-[man] Hey! -[people cheering]
Let's go!
[man] I just wanted to say, best barbecue I ever had.
translation.ko: 그동안 먹어 본 바비큐 중 최고였어요

translation.en: We made our way from California.
We've been to Memphis. We've been trying barbecue all over the US, you killed it.
translation.ko: 멤피스를 비롯한 전국 바비큐를 다 먹어봤는데 여기가 짱이에요

translation.en: -[Tootsie] Good. -Thank you.
-Come back to see us. -God bless ya.
[Daniel] After White and Hershey passed away, you could see a change,
translation.ko: 화이트와 허시가 세상을 떠나고 투치가 좀 변했어요

translation.en: you could see, uh,
a sort of openness towards fans and towards customers.
translation.ko: 자기한테 다가오는 손님이나 팬한테 마음을 좀 열었죠

translation.en: It was obviously an incredibly sad moment for her,
but she had some people to help push her through
translation.ko: 옆에서 기운을 북돋아 주는 사람들이 있었고

translation.en: and to know and understand what she had at Snow's.
translation.ko: 그들을 보면서 투치도 많은 걸 느끼고 깨달았을 거예요

translation.en: [Clay] All right, one, two, three.
[Tootsie] I have no idea what else lies in the barbecue world for me.
translation.ko: 이 일을 계속하다 보면 어떤 일이 또 펼쳐질지 모르겠어요

translation.en: And so many have come from around the world to see me,
translation.ko: 전 세계에서 많은 사람이 절 보러 와줬는데

translation.en: and it means a lot
that we can share our friendship and love for them.
translation.ko: 이렇게 우정과 사랑을 나눌 수 있단 게요

translation.en: And some of 'em, I'll never see 'em again,
translation.ko: 이 중에서 다신 못 보는 사람도 있겠지만

translation.en: but I'm happy...
that I made them happy.
